visuals.title: The Square Pulse Train
visuals.description: A periodic square pulse with width d and period T₀. The duty cycle d/T₀ controls how much of each period is 'on'.

visuals.title: Interactive: Vary the Duty Cycle
visuals.description: Adjust the duty cycle d/T₀ and watch how the pulse width changes.

visuals.title: Integration Setup: Applying the Analysis Formula
visuals.description: To find X_k, multiply the square pulse by e^{−jkω₀t} and integrate over one period. Since x(t)=1 only for |t| < d/2, the integral simplifies.

visuals.title: Derivation Flow: From Definition to sinc
visuals.description: Apply the analysis integral to the rectangular pulse, simplify using Euler's formula, arrive at sinc.

visuals.title: The Continuous sinc Envelope
visuals.description: sinc(x) = sin(πx)/(πx). The Fourier coefficients are samples of this continuous function at integer k values.

visuals.title: Fourier Coefficients: Samples of sinc Envelope
visuals.description: X_k follows a sinc envelope: X_k = (d/T₀) sinc(kd/T₀). First null at k = T₀/d.

visuals.title: Time-Bandwidth Duality: Narrow Pulse ↔ Wide Spectrum
visuals.description: A narrow pulse (small d) has a wide spectrum. A wide pulse has a narrow spectrum.

text:
Wide spectrum
(first null at large k)
Many harmonics needed

Narrow spectrum
(first null at small k)
Fewer harmonics

visuals.title: Interactive: Reconstruct the Square Pulse from Harmonics
visuals.description: Add harmonics progressively and watch the sum approximate the square pulse.

visuals.title: Convergence: Partial Sums with 3, 7, and 15 Harmonics
visuals.description: More harmonics give a better approximation. Gibbs overshoot at edges persists but narrows.

visuals.title: Interactive: Duty Cycle vs Spectrum
visuals.description: Change the duty cycle and watch the sinc envelope shift. Narrow pulses have wider spectra.
